meanings.definition: To form a word by arranging letters in the correct order.
meanings.sent1: I can spell my name correctly now.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to spell its name but ended up with 'meow'.
meanings.sent4: Her smile spelled out happiness better than any words could.
meanings.sent5: Spell it out slowly so I can understand.

meanings.definition: A period of time during which a person is under a particular influence or feeling.
meanings.sent1: After a long spell of sadness, she finally smiled.
meanings.sent2: He had a spell of dizziness after standing up too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The spell of laughter in the room was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The spell of silence was broken by a loud crash.
meanings.sent5: The spell of excitement before the party was palpable.

meanings.sent1: Wait for a spell before entering the room.
meanings.sent2: She took a short spell to catch her breath.
meanings.sent3: The spell of rain was brief but refreshing.
meanings.sent4: In a spell of panic, he dropped his keys.
meanings.sent5: A spell of sunshine brightened up the day.
